parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The client token can contain only ASCII characters.

> If you do not specify this parameter, the system automatically uses the **request ID** as the **client token**. The **request ID** may be different for each request.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description:
The description of the failover test.

The description must be 0 to 256 characters in length and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: If you set the value to true, the system performs only a dry run without actually performing the actual request. If you set the value to false, the system performs a dry run and performs the actual request. If the request passes the dry run, a 2xx HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed.

parameters.name: JobDuration
parameters.description: The duration of the failover test. Unit: minutes. Valid values: **1 to 4320**.

parameters.name: JobType
parameters.description:
The type of the failover test. Valid values:

*   **StartNow**
*   **StartLater**

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
The name of the failover test.

The name must be 0 to 128 characters in length and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the failover test.

You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceId
parameters.description: The IDs of failover test resources. You can add at most 16 resources.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description: The resource type of the failover test. Set the value to **PHYSICALCONNECTION**.
